thread.title: Same Suspect Likely Involved In Two Home Burglaries
thread.title_full: Same Suspect Likely Involved In Two Home Burglaries

title: Same Suspect Likely Involved In Two Home Burglaries
text:
Same Suspect Likely Involved In Two Home Burglaries October 19, 2015, 10:59 AM SIOUX FALLS, SD - 
Police are searching for a suspect after several burglary reports near 41st Street and Sertoma Avenue. 
Sioux Falls Police Lieutenant David McIntire said officers were called to a home on South Morrow Drive. Officers said a suspect entered the unlocked home and left with cash. 
Previous Story: Police Investigating Reports Of Attempted Home Larceny 
While officers were at the scene, McIntire said a second report came from West Oriole Circle. A suspect entered a garage, then moved to vehicles parked nearby. McIntire said there's no indication that anything was stolen at the second location. 
Police think the same suspect is involved in both burglary reports. He was described by a witness as a tall, skinny man wearing a black-hooded sweatshirt. 
McIntire advises the public to keep homes and cars locked. 
If you have any information, contact Crimestoppers at 605-367-7007. Â© 2015 KELOLAND TV. All Rights Reserved.
